Class G2Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • pkgModel.Model
      • pkgModel.G2Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    G2Tutorial

    public class G2Model
extends pkgModel.Model
    used to handle the logic of game 2 Created on 11/1/2019
    Author:
    Chandler and Matthew

    • Constructor Detail

      • G2Model

        public G2Model(boolean decision,
               pkgModel.GameStatsModel gModel,
               long currentTime,
               double canvasWidth,
               double canvasHeight,
               double robotWidth,
               double robotHeight,
               double fishWidth,
               double fishHeight,
               double crustWidth,
               double crustHeight,
               int tool)
        Constructor of the G2Model class
        Parameters:
        decision - boolean, used to tell the minigame which decision the player went with so it can impact the minigame.
        gModel - GameStatsModel, gameStatsModel to store scoring information between games
        currentTime - long, time in miliseconds that the game lasts
        canvasWidth - double, the canvas width of the javaFx window.
        canvasHeight - double, the canvas height of the javaFx window.
        robotWidth - double, width of the robot image to be drawn, used in the collision detection.
        robotHeight - double, height of the robot image to be drawn, used in the collision detection.
        fishWidth - double, width of the fish image, used in collision detection.
        fishHeight - double, height of the fish image, used in collision detection.
        crustWidth - double, width of the crustacean image, used in collision detection.
        crustHeight - double, height of the crustacan image, used in collision detection.
        tool - int, represents the tool that the player should start with

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public boolean update(double clickOnPosX,
                      double clickOnPosY,
                      boolean doAction,
                      int tool,
                      long currentTime)
        Removes fish from the fish list if they have been caught/a picture has been taken of them, also calls the updateFishList method. Allows the player robot to move
        Parameters:
        clickOnPosX - double where the Player clicked
        clickOnPosY - double where the Player clicked
        doAction - boolean, a boolean value that is true if a picture was taken and false if one was not.
        tool - int, the tool that the player has selected
        currentTime - long, the time left in the game
        Returns:
        boolean, if true the game is still occuring, if false the game is over.

      • updateAnimalList

        public void updateAnimalList()
        iterates through animalList and calls update on each Animal. Also calls randomizeSlope() if the animal goes off screen.

      • getRobot

        public G2Player getRobot()
        returns robot to obtain state and location in view
        Returns:
        G2Player, robot contains location and state of player

      • checkCollisions

        public int checkCollisions(double clickOnPosX,
                           double clickOnPosY)
        checks to see if there is an animal where the mouse clicked and if it is within the needed hitbox. If collision occurs returns index of ArrayList animal corresponding to animal which was acted on. If not, returns -1.
        Parameters:
        clickOnPosX - xPosition of mouse click
        clickOnPosY - yPosition of mouse click
        Returns:
        index int corresponding to index in ArrayList of Animals where collision occured

      • getAnimalList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Animal> getAnimalList()
        returns the Animals list
        Returns:
        the list of Animals

      • takeAction

        public void takeAction(boolean takeAction,
                       double clickOnPosX,
                       double clickOnPosY)
        returns the index of the animal that the action is successfully acted on. Successfully taken if action is taken when the robot is colliding with the animal.
        Parameters:
        takeAction - true if the player is taking a picture, or capturing and animal
        clickOnPosX - the xposition of the mouse after a click
        clickOnPosY - the y position of the mouse after a click

      • getObjectiveList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getObjectiveList()
        returns the objectiveList
        Returns:
        the list that contains all the names of the animals that need to be capture and have their picture taken.

      • setObjectiveList

        public void setObjectiveList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> objectiveList)
        sets the objectiveList
        Parameters:
        objectiveList - the ArrayList of strings that the objectiveList is set to.

      • getTimeRemaining

        public long getTimeRemaining()
        returns the remaining time for the game
        Returns:
        timeRemaining, time to display in the timer
